subject: Cybersecurity
title: Operation Aurora: Hacking Google
description: One-minute skill: Operation Aurora: Hacking Google.

hook.text: In 2009, Chinese hackers broke into Google to access the Gmail accounts of Chinese human rights activists.

buildup.text: Operation Aurora targeted 34 companies including Google, Adobe, and Morgan Stanley using zero-day IE exploits.

discovery.text: The attackers wanted source code and, specifically, the Gmail accounts of dissidents â€” espionage disguised as hacking.

twist.text: Google's response was unprecedented: they threatened to leave China entirely and began encrypting all internal traffic.

climax.text: Aurora forced big tech to treat nation-state attackers as a core threat, not just an edge case.

punchline.text: China hacked Google to spy on human rights activists.

quiz.question: What was the primary target of Operation Aurora against Google?
options: Gmail accounts of Chinese human rights activists
